page.title: 16ASHWELL OPEN PRISON
page.content: The prisoners here are serving sentences for lesss serious crimes together with lifers at the end of their sentences. They live in ex_army huts which are gradually being replaced by brick_built two_storey blocks with well equipped single rooms. There are about 200 staff. Courses are provided in skills pertaining to building construction, electronics and business as well a basic education. The prisoners work as orderlies, cleaners and storekeepers. They do running repairs and kitchen work in the prison and some are occupied in the knitwear and footwear industries. Recreative activities include T.V. with video, a library, snooker, darts, cricket and football.
